title: Love Island's Olivia Buckland and Alex Bowen share a kiss as they pack on the PDA
text:
They recently celebrated their first wedding anniversary after tying the knot in a lavish Essex ceremony in September 2018.

But Olivia Buckland and Alex Bowen looked like they were still very much in the honeymoon period as they packed on the PDA after enjoying a night out at the Deliveroo Awards at Shoreditch Town Hall in east London on Thursday.

The Love Island couple - who met on the ITV2 dating show in 2016 - puckered up for a sweet kiss as they headed home from the takeaway bash.

Loved-up: Olivia Buckland and Alex Bowen packed on the PDA after enjoying a night out at the Deliveroo Awards at Shoreditch Town Hall in east London on Thursday

Olivia, 25, flaunted her curves in a figure-hugging dark blue floor-length dress which was heavily adorned with silver gems.

The reality star added height to her frame with a pair of nude patent stiletto heels and accessorised with delicate pearl drop earrings.

The TV personality wore her blonde hair in an elegant up-do and opted for smokey eye make-up.

Alex, 27, looked dapper in a smart grey blazer, black trousers and a basic T-shirt, adding some bling in the form of a gold chain and his watch.

In a recent interview with MailOnline, Olivia revealed her mother was 'scared' for her to do a reality TV show with her husband Alex Bowen.

The fashion designer, who found love with Alex on the 2016 series of Love Island where they finished as runners up, admitted some of her family had reservations about her returning to the world of reality TV.

Olivia and Alex documented their wedding on TLC's Olivia and Alex Said Yes with their latest series, Happily Ever After, documenting their married life.

Beauty: The reality star added height to her frame with a pair of nude patent stiletto heels and accessorised with delicate pearl drop earrings

Couple: Alex and Olivia appeared to be having a great time as they posed for snaps at the awards and wrapped a loving arm around each other

She explained: 'We were a bit scared to do reality TV as a couple. My mum was scared. She was worried about us being at the forefront of it all. But she loves it now.'

The pair told how they were more than happy to show all aspects of their relationship on the series but wanted their families kept away from the cameras.

Alex said: 'TLC did our wedding programme. They never asked us to do anything we didn't want to do. It's happy and fun and loving.

'It feels like so long ago now since we filmed it. When we watched it back, we had forgot half of it.'
